newsitem.title: USA: Rubin says U.S. tax cuts will not explode deficits.
newsitem.headline: Rubin says U.S. tax cuts will not explode deficits.

text.p: U.S. Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin said Tuesday the budget deal reached with Congressional leaders will not explode future deficits.

There had been concern that some of the proposed elements of the tax bill, particularly a provision that would have indexed capital gains to take into account increases due to inflation, would cause deficits to rise dramatically in the later years.
"The capital gains taxes actually do not create the exploding problem," Rubin said. "The only problem there that created explosion was indexing, and indexing was taken out of the bill."
